{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3597439,"name":"","username":"baysal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baysal/{size}/264934_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T03:50:04.498Z","cooked":"

Our team has been running SDS swerve modules for the last 4 seasons ‚ÄîMk4 and MK4is ‚Äî and they‚Äôve definitely treated us well. But as we start prepping for the next seasons, we‚Äôre seriously considering a switch.

We‚Äôre currently comparing:
‚Ä¢ WCP X2-ST
‚Ä¢ SDS MK4N

If you‚Äôve used either (or both), we‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts. Especially on:
‚Ä¢ Durability and maintenance across multiple events
‚Ä¢ Driving feel and performance under defense
‚Ä¢ Encoder setup (we use CANcoders for absolute position)
‚Ä¢ Packaging or mounting differences
‚Ä¢ Any ‚Äúwe wish we knew this earlier‚Äù moments

We‚Äôre not switching just for fun ‚Äî we want to make a call based on real-world value for performance, reliability, and maintenance effort.

Would really appreciate any insights, pros/cons, or even CAD examples if you‚Äôre willing to share.!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T03:50:04.498Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":91,"reads":1037,"readers_count":1036,"score":712.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5665 Fabrication & Assembly Lead"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597450,"name":"","username":"Camo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/camo/{size}/195643_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T03:57:03.281Z","cooked":"

tbh I would wait for the mk5 that sds showcased at the championship. Looks so much smaller than the mk4n and also supports 2in wide tread that comes with wcp swerve. Also from the photos of mk5 comes with a swerve cover that covers the gear and it also covers the bevel gear so that no carpet can get into the bevel gear.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T03:57:03.281Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":995,"readers_count":994,"score":379.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59517,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5584"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597470,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T04:19:47.737Z","cooked":"

One thing that puts me off of SDS is the use of belts. Given the choice, I‚Äôd rather not have belts in my modules.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T04:19:47.737Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":951,"readers_count":950,"score":240.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59517,"username":"Camo","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/camo/{size}/195643_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597473,"name":"","username":"Camo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/camo/{size}/195643_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T04:23:34.221Z","cooked":"

I don‚Äôt think there are any belts in the mk5. From the image it looks like a gear for steer now. It is hard to see because of the cover but I don‚Äôt see a belt unless it has it and they just didn‚Äôt install it on this module.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T04:23:34.221Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":941,"readers_count":940,"score":338.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59517,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5584"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597488,"name":"Duncan Macdonald","username":"Duncan_Macdonald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/duncan_macdonald/{size}/2042_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T04:53:36.778Z","cooked":"

My swerve purchase decision tree:

  1. Is it griplock compatible?
  2. Can my existing modules/components be used as drop in spare parts?
  3. Cost.
  4. How many gear ratios come standard.
  5. Weight
  6. Powder coating
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T04:53:36.778Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":888,"readers_count":887,"score":202.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Duncan Macdonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá®üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597525,"name":"doruk bazan","username":"dorukbzn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dorukbzn/{size}/258622_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T10:04:28.066Z","cooked":"

If you have financial difficulties, it would be better to buy a mk4i to mk4n conversion kit. If the necessary finance can be provided, I recommend wcp modules because they are faster than sds modules and do not have belt problems (such as belt breakage) that occur in sds modules. The only point I can say is worse than sds is that repairing the modules is more difficult than sds. and cancoder can also be used.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T10:04:28.066Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":847,"readers_count":846,"score":214.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"doruk bazan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8557 Mechanical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597530,"name":"Jimmy McCosker","username":"Jimmyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T10:23:40.975Z","cooked":"

Okay, but to be fair, that belt is in such a low-load application (azimuth) that it really doesn‚Äôt matter that much.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T10:23:40.975Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":825,"readers_count":824,"score":235.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Jimmy McCosker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/7","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597531,"name":"doruk bazan","username":"dorukbzn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dorukbzn/{size}/258622_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T10:26:53.723Z","cooked":"

Last year, the MK4i belt of the 9483 team broke. Frankly, the use of belts scares me just as much.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T10:26:53.723Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":815,"readers_count":814,"score":178.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"doruk bazan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52943,"username":"Jimmyy","name":"Jimmy McCosker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8557 Mechanical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597532,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T10:30:49.886Z","cooked":"
Jimmyy:

Okay, but to be fair, that belt is in such a low-load application (azimuth) that it really doesn‚Äôt matter that much.

Its significantly higher load than you think it is. If we were only spinning the modules slowly, sure, but FRC swerve spins the modules with extremely high acceleration, leading to high dynamic loads which are significantly higher than you think they are. The mk4 style pulley not having full teeth engagement and having an extremely small pinion pulley isn‚Äôt the proper way to use HTD belts does not help with lifespan. This is further supported by the fact that teams do break the mk4i belts sometimes.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T10:30:49.886Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":801,"readers_count":800,"score":250.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597562,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T12:43:56.794Z","cooked":"

I was talking to the guy at the SDS table at champs and he talked about switching to a gear for MK5 because ‚Äúsome teams don‚Äôt use current limits.‚Äù He said 2910 has never had any breakage issues with the belt in their whole time using them.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T12:43:56.794Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":716,"readers_count":715,"score":248.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/FIRST in Alabama YAC"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597571,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T13:02:17.521Z","cooked":"
Duncan_Macdonald:

My swerve purchase decision tree:

  1. Is it griplock compatible?
  2. Can my existing modules/components be used as drop in spare parts?
  3. Cost.
  4. How many gear ratios come standard.
  5. Weight
  6. Powder coating

I have a different decision tree. I loved sds swerve, but my list is now:

  1. Does the supplier keep items in stock.
  2. Does the supplier update stock announcements accurately
  3. Did the supplier respond quickly to issues.

Unfortunately while the product was great, SDS‚Äôs fell short on our expectations of these key items.

We swapped to WCP and have not regretted it.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T13:02:17.521Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":699,"readers_count":698,"score":224.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597573,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T13:03:38.300Z","cooked":"

I can confirm we ran two seasons with the same belts and it only failed when a fastener locked the module and our high current limits shredded the belt. The Sds Is a great product.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T13:03:38.300Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":657,"readers_count":656,"score":206.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51417,"username":"CuteRedpandas","name":"Jared Van Horn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597588,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T13:29:05.883Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm a big fan of Swerve X and my team plans on sticking to it. However after seeing the MK5 I honestly think it‚Äôs the way to go. There‚Äôs a whole lot of serviceability built into it that is very cool, and the covering of it means there‚Äôs going to be a whole lot less debris stuck in the gears. However that‚Äôs just my opinion and it does not take account for budget or the cost of the MK5 since it is yet to be announced.

We used Mk4n this season. It worked great and we were able to squeeze our elevator between them due to the amount of space we had left over. Apparently they announced mk5s, but if that‚Äôs not in the budget then I‚Äôd get the mk4i to mk4n conversion kit

We started using SwerveX because that‚Äôs what we could buy in the time frame we needed. We liked the corner biased variant. It has been dead solid. The encoders we used when we used NEOs were fussy ‚Äì Krakens solved that. The only real maintenance has been cleaning out the greasy carpet fuzz balls every so often. If SDS has truly solved that, that‚Äôs definitely a point in their column.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T16:02:39.511Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":591,"readers_count":590,"score":163.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/16","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597757,"name":"Nick Matthes ","username":"nmatthes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nmatthes/{size}/193329_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T16:20:51.824Z","cooked":"

As an WCP X2ST user this season- this is one of the best modules we have used.

baysal:

Durability and maintenance across multiple events
‚Ä¢ Driving feel and performance under defense
‚Ä¢ Encoder setup (we use CANcoders for absolute position)
‚Ä¢ Packaging or mounting differences
‚Ä¢ Any ‚Äúwe wish we knew this earlier‚Äù moments

-we had little to no maintenance needed across events. Basic grease and tread change. That‚Äôs it.
-the WCP molded tread this year was a big hit for us this year. Price point was great, super easy to change, and liked the traction we were getting with defense.
-we utilized the Throughbore encoders this year. Very pleased with them.
-just have to plan chassis around the footprint of the module. Nothing extra than any other module on the market.
-we wish the module was out earlier so we could have used it previously!

Note: 33 is sponsored by WestCoast Products but these comments are our true feeling, sponsored or not

I‚Äôve been using the MK4is for two years. The belt is never an issue

Actually, the whole module is solid, and I‚Äôve never had any issues that were not our fault.

I wish they were smaller though. It does get tricky to design around them

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-21T13:10:25.100Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":535,"readers_count":534,"score":127.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/18","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3597838,"name":"Matt Golman","username":"BordomBeThyName","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bordombethyname/{size}/147649_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T18:09:51.221Z","cooked":"

Mk4i is a great module and won‚Äôt hold you back. If you always want to have the best of the best then you‚Äôre likely going to be swapping back and forth between suppliers until the end of time.

We used X2T modules this year. The wide tread, form factor, wheelbase, and geared steering make them feel like a real step up from the Mk4i modules we were using previously.

I‚Äôd hold off until more information comes out, but the Mk5 looks like it might be a small step up over the WCP modules, mostly for the ease of swapping ratios. The wheels are also even wider, although it‚Äôs hard to say if there‚Äôs a meaningful difference in performance there.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":25,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T18:09:51.221Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":293.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499869,"topic_slug":"sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice","display_username":"Matt Golman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9246,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mechanical/Strategy Mentor | 1678"},"post_url":"/t/sds-to-wcp-looking-for-long-term-swerve-advice/499869/19","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3599552,"name":"Lewis","username":"ljruskin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/ebca7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T04:24:10.845Z","cooked":"

The modules make way less of a difference than the motors and code do. The next most important thing is did you read the manual and apply locktite and grease where you are supposed to. in my dumb opinion, while pricy, the easiest way to a controlled, battery sipping drive is ctre motors on both drive and steer, pigeon 2, canivore, and a pro license. Then ctre swerve generator + advantage kit sketch. we have tried every combo of wcp, rev, and sds, and both rev motors and ctre motors, and even just krakens on all motors was significantly easier.
